author: George Bellshaw
title: Manchester United to face Manchester City, Real Madrid and Barcelona in USA this summer
text:
Mourinho will take on Guardiola (Picture: AFP/Getty) Manchester United will take on Manchester City, Barcelona and Real Madrid in a high-profile set of pre-season fixtures in America this summer.
Brandt, Weigl and the Germany players PL bosses will be watching v England The Red Devils have agreed to participate in the International Champions Cup, which will see some of the world’s biggest clubs face off in the USA.
Paris Saint-Germain, Juventus, Roma and Tottenham Hotspur will also be involved in what promises to be a quality off-season event.
Jose Mourinho’s men will open their U.S. schedule against local rivals Manchester City on July 20, although the venue is still yet to be confirmed.
More: Football Time for a reality check: Arsenal is as good as it's going to get for Mesut Ozil 
Jose Mourinho wants Chelsea star and Tottenham ace with £25m release clause at Man Utd 
Liverpool ready to TRIPLE wage offer from Real Madrid to snap up wanted left-back 
United will then face former Red Devil Cristiano Ronaldo and Real Madrid in Santa Clara, California on July 23, before traveling to Washington DC on July 26 to face Lionel Messi’s Barcelona.
Before facing the European giants, United will take on MLS sides LA Galaxy and Real Salt Lake at their respective stadiums.
International Champions Cup fixtures Paris Saint-Germain vs. Roma – Venue TBD, July 19 Manchester United vs. Manchester City – Venue TBD, July 20
Barcelona vs. Juventus – East Rutherford, New Jersey (MetLife Stadium), July 22
Tottenham vs. Paris Saint-Germain – Orlando (Camping World Stadium), July 22
Manchester United vs. Real Madrid – Santa Clara, California (Levi’s Stadium), July 23
Roma vs. Tottenham – bHarrison, New Jersey (Red Bull Arena), July 25
Manchester United vs. Barcelona – Landover, Md. (FedEx Field), July 26
Paris Saint-Germain vs. Juventus – Miami (Hard Rock Stadium), July 26
Real Madrid vs. Manchester City – Los Angeles (LA Coliseum), July 26
Manchester City vs. Tottenham – Nashville, Tenn. (Nissan Stadium), July 29
Real Madrid vs. Barcelona – Miami (Hard Rock Stadium)

Juventus vs. Roma – Foxborough, Mass. (Gillette Stadium), July 30
